intro: Erica mucosoides, commonly known as the sticky heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, acidic soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous regions. Erica mucosoides is well adapted to dry conditions, with small, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to white, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
